Hi! I’m Shivam Verma. I’m an open source enthusiast, a ubiquitous computing researcher, traveler and music lover.

I’m 24 and currently work as a Research Assistant at the Felicitous Computing Institute, National University of Singapore.

I graduated from the Goa Campus of BITS Pilani with a Bachelors in Information Systems and prior to joining NUS, I worked as a Software Developer at Teewe in Bangalore, India.

On the open source front, I started the Android version of Privly as a Google Summer of Code student in 2013 and have since been maintaining the project. I also frequently contribute to the Ambient Dynamix Project.

I’ve traveled extensively in India. I’ve also been to Japan, the USA and South Korea. New Zealand currently is on the top of my travel bucket list.

Contact

You can drop me an email at first-name[dot]bitsgoa[at]gmail.com or tweet to me @vshivam.
